definition: east/host (i.e. sitting on east side of guest)/landlord

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

pinyin: dong1 jia1 chang2 xi1 jia1 duan3

sentences.english: Joe Cole on the new owner reveals his adulation.
sentences.chinese: 乔科尔对新东家流露出崇拜之情。

sentences.english: One of the proprietors had suggested that the chorus was a little weak on looks.
sentences.chinese: 有一个东家曾经提到过，群舞队员的相貌差了一些。

sentences.english: Dongjiaxishe at the same time, north to south is not more than a month.
sentences.chinese: 东家西舍同时发，北去南来不逾月。

sentences.english: I look forward to welcoming my old club to Prenton Park ahead of the new season.
sentences.chinese: 季前赛我欢迎我的老东家做客普雷顿公园。

sentences.english: He is now on his way to Switzerland to team-up with his new Liverpool team-mates.
sentences.chinese: 他现在去瑞士与他的新东家利物浦会合。

sentences.english: Soon the master appeared to see that all was in order.
sentences.chinese: 不久，东家老爷姚思安出来了，看一切齐备了没有。

sentences.english: Trenven used his head to touch his young lord's body to show understanding.
sentences.chinese: 川文用他的头蹭了蹭少东家的身子，以表示理解。

sentences.english: Steinberg left IMG at the end of May.
sentences.chinese: 史坦伯格在五月末离开了老东家IMG经纪公司。

sentences.english: Dennis Oh, building a new nest for new year, devoting to acting.
sentences.chinese: 小丹，新年换了新东家，致力于演艺事业。
第18副，东家发排，南北有局。

sentences.english: Babs gave up a second spade, and East returned the diamond seven.
sentences.chinese: Babs放弃第二墩黑桃，接着东家回打方块7。

sentences.english: Well, they belong to the same master, retorted the yard-dog.
sentences.chinese: 嗯，他们有同一个东家，狗儿争辩道。

definition: to manage the household/to be the one in charge of the family/to call the shots/to be in charge
player whose turn comes next (in a game)/next one/my humble home
to improve one's family's social status by moving up in the world/to switch one's allegiance to a new patron
old man/I (an old man referring to himself)
variant of 老闆|老板[lao3 ban3]
an accounts office (in former times)/an accountant/a cashier
great family/rich family/large landlord/conspicuous spender or consumer
